node.doctext:
This is a storage node for CST reviews. Reviews are moved her from our working area in [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on 09/18/05, When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_19].

See also CST Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1] - [CST_Storage_18|18].

-----------Batch Processed 11/27/05 by [GrouchyOldMan]------

Writeup Title: [Colon Blow]
Author: [geneva]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: No
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2005.11.11 (5.3 hr) dannye says We have a new user posting comedy skits. [Colon Blow]. I think those are off limits, eh?
Hi there, Bad news I'm afraid. this writeup doesn't appear to be compliant with the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 Copyright Policy]. For fair use compliance the quote should be less than 250 words total and 33% or less of the total wordcount. If you'd like to add more original content to bring it into compliance and repost, I'd be glad to assist you.
Tc = 421, Tq = 326, %q= 77%

Writeup Title: [Manfred]
Author: [nocodeforparanoia]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: Yes
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:
Hi there. Good news, I'm pleased to report that this project appears to be completely compliant with [E2 Copyright Changes|E2 copyright policy]. Near as I can tell, the work is in the public domain and you've cited your source properly. Feel free to add the [CST Approved] tag to the wus. Nice job|Rawk on].

Writeup Title:[Galadriel]
Author:[nocodeforparanoia]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%:92%
Compliance Assessment:
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2005.10.18@20:35 [yclept] says [Galadriel] looks to be a copyright mess.
Hello nocodeforparanoia, Unfortunately since the [E2 copyright changes] copyrighted work can no longer be kept in the database. As it stands now the quoted part is 92 % of the write up and to meet fair use it can only be 33%. One suggestion would be to consider adding more original content so the write up meets [fair use]. There is more about copyright at [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. Please let me know what you would like to do.
2005.10.23@7:08 [nocodeforparanoia] says ...and thank you. hmm... Galadriel.... don't even remember noding that. I'll see what I can find on it. if I can't find anything good on it, i'll nuke request it. thank you for having the rare gift of keeping folks on their toes and doing it in a compassionate way!
Hey there, I’ll check back next [October 29, 2005|Saturady] to see if [Galadriel] has been updated. If not it has to be removed so we don’t get in trouble. It can always be updated and resubmitted when you feel ready to:)
2005.10.29@6:14 [nocodeforparanoia] says re [Galadriel]: it seems I haven't had the time to do anything with this in a week. Go ahead and kill it. If I have time for it in the future, I'll resubmit. Thanks.

Writeup Title:[N.W.O.]
Author:[skweejeepusher]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 38%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.10.25@15:07 skweejeepusher says hello. I heard a rumor that lyrics were being removed for copyright reasons. If that's true, my writeup N.W.O. needs to die. I don't know if this is the right way to go about this, I haven't been updating in a year or two and forgot how everything works.
Welcome back! Let me take a look.
2005.10.25@15:07 skweejeepusher says I probably won't be checking my inbox but i'm just giving you a heads up.
It’s a close call. If you can add about three or four sentences to it, it can stay in the database. Like maybe when it was released and who composed the lyrics.
No reply. Write up removed at user’s request.

Hi there, Bad news I'm afraid. I'm assuming that you didn't write the lyrics, or have permission of the author, but this writeup doesn't appear to be compliant with the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 Copyright Policy]. For fair use compliance the quote should be 33% or less of the total wordcount, this one is 91% copied . If you'd like to add more original content to bring it into compliance and repost, I'd be glad to assist you.

Writeup Title:[Simon Says]
Author:[Kaytay]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 73%
Compliance Assessment: (Y/N)
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2005.10.15@22:57 Simulacron3 says [Simon Says] by Kaytay
Hello Kaytay, Unfortunately since the [E2 copyright changes] copyrighted work can no longer be kept in the database. As it stands now the quoted part of [Simon Says] is 73 % of the write up and cut off is 33%. One suggestion would be to consider adding more original content so the write up meets [fair use]. There is more about copyright at [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. If I don’t hear from you by next [October 22,2005|Saturday], I’ll assume you don’t want to update it at this time and remove it.
Hello kaytay, I was hoping you would log on sometime during the week, but alas we cannot keep copyrighted work in the database. Both [Drain STH] and [Simon Says] have to go. If you would like to update and resubmit them you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for suggestions and ideas.
2005.10.24@9:08 kaytay says Thanks for keeping me updated on the copyright stuff. If any of my writeups aren't in line with the policies, feel free to send them on to Node Heaven. I'm not much for noding these days, though I'm still around now and then. Thanks again :)

Author:[Kaytay]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%:61%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: Hello Kaytay, Unfortunately [Drain STH ] also exceeds fair use with 61% of the content as a quoted source. You could also consider adding more original content so the write up meets [fair use]. Again I will wait until next [October 22,2005|Saturday], I’ll assume you don’t want to update it at this time and remove it if I haven’t heard from you by then. Hello kaytay, I was hoping you would log on sometime during the week, but alas we cannot keep copyrighted work in the database. Both [Drain STH] and [Simon Says] have to go. If you would like to update and resubmit them you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for suggestions and ideas.
2005.10.24@9:08 kaytay says Thanks for keeping me updated on the copyright stuff. If any of my writeups aren't in line with the policies, feel free to send them on to Node Heaven. I'm not much for noding these days, though I'm still around now and then. Thanks again :)

Writeup Title:[sleigh ride]
Author:[shmOOnkie pOOnks]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 26%
Compliance Assessment: yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.10.12@4:38 [Simulacron3] says [sleigh ride]
Hello shmOOnkie pOOnks, Unfortunately since the [E2 copyright changes] copyrighted work can no longer be kept in the database. As it stands now the quoted part is 53 % of the write up and the cut off is 33%. Lyrics cannot exceed 250 words so one suggestion would be to consider adding more original content and reducing the lyrics. There is more about copyright at [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. If I don’t hear from you by next [October 22,2005|Saturday], I’ll assume you don’t want to update it at this time and remove it.
2005.10.17@5:39 [shmOOnkie pOOnks] says thanks for the heads up. I recall you from e2's days of yore.
I remember you too:) [sleigh ride] has been re evaluated by the [CST_Group] and looks good to go. If you would like to you may append this hardlink [CST Approved] . Thank you!

Writeup Title:[Robot Tank]
Author:[TheBooBooKitty]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 6%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: Hey there! Bad news. This doesn’t pass muster for copyright compliance. As it stands now the quoted part is 53 % of the write up and the cut off is 33%. A couple of suggestion would be to consider adding more original content or reducing the quote or a combination of both. There is more about copyright at [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. If I don’t hear from you by [October 15,2005|Saturday], I’ll assume you don’t want to update it at this time and remove it.
2005.10.12@14:46 TheBooBooKitty says Hi Lometa. I never even thought of that. It was an old node. I had killed, then updated and resumbitted. I'll go over them all and get them down to 33 percent.
Ah I see now. There are nine of them. Here are their titles, [Keystone Kapers], [Kung Fu Master], [Robot Tank], [H.e.r.o.],[ skiing], [Sky Jinks],[ SeaQuest],[ Yars' Revenge], and [The Dreadnaught Factor]. Let’s give it until next [October 19,2005|Wednesday] since there are so many. Does that sound okay?
2005.10.12@14:55 TheBooBooKitty says Pretty sure I got robot tank under compliance now. My word counter has it at 34 percent quote now. I'll check my other recent ones tommorrow, and I start checking the old ones after that.
I have 36 % it has to be 33% or less. Use the word count in the header if you have it turned on. For some reason it gives you a few more words and works to your advantage. Let me know when you're ready and I'll evaluate them again:)
2005.10.12@14:57 TheBooBooKitty says I'll trim all those tommorrow. I am more worried about the 50 or 100 of them from 4 years ago. I'll have to check all my cartridge nodes one by one, which will take longer.
Okay, it would be best to take care of the new ones first or he editors may nuke them after a while. When you have the older ones ready message the titles with a link to [Content_Salvage] and we will go through them for [CST Approved|CST approval]. I hear ya, I had to go through hundreds of poems during the [e2 copyright changes] and check them for compliance then get them reviewed by the Content Salvage team.
2005.10.12@15:02 TheBooBooKitty says I am just going to cut the programmers tips thing down to one paragraph in each node so it ceases to be a problem at all.
2005.10.12@15:06 TheBooBooKitty says Oh, and you can go ahead an kill Yar's Revenge there isn't a thing I can do with that one, the whole concept is that it was the transcipt of a terrible commerical song. I can't cut it down, and anything I added would be pure filler.
Okay. I'm so sorry all this hard work.
2005.10.12@15:10 TheBooBooKitty says All the recent ones should be fine now.
This has been reviewed and is compliant. If you would like to you can append this hardlink [CST Approved] .

When you have the older ones ready message the titles with a link to [Content_Salvage] and we will go through them for [CST Approved|CST approval]. I hear ya, I had to go through hundreds of poems during the [e2 copyright changes] and check them for compliance then get them reviewed by the Content Salvage team.
2005.10.12@15:02 TheBooBooKitty says I am just going to cut the programmers tips thing down to one paragraph in each node so it ceases to be a problem at all.
2005.10.12@15:06 TheBooBooKitty says Oh, and you can go ahead an kill Yar's Revenge there isn't a thing I can do with that one, the whole concept is that it was the transcipt of a terrible commerical song. I can't cut it down, and anything I added would be pure filler.
Okay. I'm so sorry all this hard work.
2005.10.12@15:10 TheBooBooKitty says All the recent ones should be fine now.
This has been reviewed and is compliant. If you would like to you can append this hardlink [CST Approved] .

Writeup Title:[The Eye of the World]
Author:[kaatunut]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 13%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2005.10.2@15:45 Lord Brawl says Could someone deal with [eien_meru]'s [Broken Nodes] entry?
[eien_meru]'s broken node entry said, “Two separate copyright violations in [The Eye of the World] - the 'ultra-condensed' version at the end of [kaatunut]'s and the annoyingly long chapter-by-chapter summary at the end of [kelrin]'s. Cited, yes, but I don't think there's enough original content there for fair use to kick in.
I might be wrong.
A similar problem faces all of [kaatunut]'s wheel of time writeups – [The Great Hunt], [The Dragon Reborn], and [The Shadow Rising].”
Hello kaatunut, This write up was submitted to the [CST_Group] and is compliant with the [E2 copyright changes]. The chapter list is not subject to copyright and was excluded in the evaluation. If you want to you may append this hardlink [CST Approved] .
